abstract.text: Update your apps to use new features, and test your apps against API changes.

inlineContent.text: The tvOS 15 SDK provides support to develop tvOS apps for Apple TV devices running tvOS 15. The SDK comes bundled with Xcode 13, available from the Mac App Store. For information on the compatibility requirements for Xcode 13, see

that returns signed information for any transactions where the app still needs to deliver content to the user. (79620896)
is available in StoreKit 2. You can use this purchase option to determine whether the transaction continues if the App Store storefront changes during a transaction. The default is
to provide a reason for unverified signed values.

Fixed an issue where purchases performed in the Sandbox environment returned
for transactions that have already finished. (81346114)

Support for cleartext HTTP URL schemes for Proxy Automatic Configuration (PAC) is now deprecated. Use only HTTPS URL schemes for PAC. This affects all PAC configurations, including, but not limited to, configurations set via Settings, System Preferences, profiles, and

. If you configure a cleartext HTTP PAC URL, the system may upgrade it to HTTPS during PAC file loads. Web Proxy Auto-Discovery (WPAD) Protocol via DNS isn’t affected. Dynamic Host Configuration Protocol (DHCP) Option 252 WPAD may attempt to upgrade cleartext HTTP URLs to HTTPS during PAC file loads. (61981845)

sends has an updated format and corrected values for multiple locales. In addition to the preferred language, the header also includes the current system language as a fallback if it differs from the preferred language. This behavior affects apps that link against macOS 12, iOS 15, tvOS 15, and watchOS 8 SDKs. (38772422)
SharePlay development in beta 7 and upcoming beta releases requires the installation of an updated
. This profile enables successful creation and reception of GroupSessions via the Group Activities API in iOS 15, iPadOS 15 and tvOS 15 beta 7, as well as macOS Monterey beta 6. (81816137)

2 introduces a modern Swift-based API that takes advantage of new language features like Swift concurrency. Use this API to load product information, display in-app purchases in your store, allow customers to make purchases, manage access to content and subscriptions, and receive transaction information signed by the App Store in JSON Web Signature (JWS) format. (66587964)
can now contain Markdown syntax. The system parses Markdown strings when you create a
views created with a string literal. The system styles
respects the styles you provide through attributes within the SwiftUI attribute scope; these styles take precedence over styles you provide through view modifiers. (74841755)
Specific kinds of animations now execute off the main thread, so there are new thread-safety requirements. (70524799)
Ensure the following functions and types are thread-safe:

modifier, the suggestion list now disappears rather than displaying the single suggestion you selected. (76965399)

views that contain excessive line height characters now have a larger default size to avoid clipping or overlapping of oversized characters. (80665315)

abstract.text: Downloads a proxy autoconfiguration script and executes it.
A type of object with a publisher that emits before the object has changed.
An annotation view that displays a pin image on the map.
A pin-shaped annotation used to indicate a location on a map.
Integrate your app with Apple Music.
Support In-App Purchases and interactions with the App Store.
Information about a product that you configure in App Store Connect.
Optional settings for a product purchase that add account information, purchase details, and offers, or that specify behaviors.
Adds a string for a custom key to a purchase.
Adds a number for a custom key to a purchase.
Adds data for a custom key to a purchase.
Adds a Boolean value for a custom key to a purchase.
Indicates whether a transaction needs to continue if the App Store storefront changes on the device during the transaction.
The JSON representation of the subscription renewal information.
The renewal status information for an auto-renewable subscription.
An asynchronous sequence that listens for new subscription status information.
The signed renewal information for the auto-renewable subscription.
Requests product data from the App Store.
The user canceled.
The region and unique identifier of the App Store storefront for the device.
An asynchronous sequence that listens for changes to the storefront.
The asynchronous sequence that emits storefront information when the system updates the storefront.
Information that represents the customer’s purchase of a product in your app.
An asynchronous sequence of transactions.
The JSON representation of the transaction information.
A sequence that emits unfinished transactions for the customer.
The asynchronous sequence that emits a transaction when the system creates or updates transactions that occur outside the app or on other devices.
A type that describes the result of a StoreKit verification.
The verified value of the signed type that StoreKit confirms as verified.
The associated value of the verification result that StoreKit doesn’t confirm as verified.
A type that provides asynchronous, sequential, iterated access to its elements.
A type that can be compared for value equality.
A type that can be hashed into a `Hasher` to produce an integer hash value.
A class of types whose instances hold the value of an entity with stable identity.
A unit of asynchronous work.
A type that you use to create custom alignment guides.
A type that describes how to animate a property of a view.
A modifier that can create another modifier with animation.
A type that applies standard interaction behavior and a custom appearance to all buttons within a view hierarchy.
A key for accessing values in the environment.
A collection of environment values propagated through a view hierarchy.
An action that opens a URL.
A structure that computes views on demand from an underlying collection of identified data.
An effect that changes the visual appearance of a view, largely without changing its ancestors or descendants.
A container view that defines its content as a function of its own size and coordinate space.
A control for navigating to a URL.
The key used to look up an entry in a strings file or strings dictionary file.
A named value produced by a view.
A 2D shape that you can use when drawing a view.
A view that displays one or more lines of read-only text.
A control that displays an editable text interface.
A type that can serve as the animatable data of an animatable type.
A type that represents part of your app’s user interface and provides modifiers that you use to configure views.
Defines the content shape for hit testing.
A modifier that you apply to a view or another view modifier, producing a different version of the original value.
Update your apps to use new features, and test your apps against API changes.
A value type for a string with associated attributes for portions of its text.
Attribute scopes that SwiftUI defines.
A type that converts a given data type into a representation in another type, such as a string.
An abstract class that declares an interface for objects that create, interpret, and validate the textual representation of values.
An object that coordinates a group of related, network data transfer tasks.
A dictionary containing information about the proxy to use within this session.
